clinical_study.brief_title: Clinical Management of Argatroban in Patients With Heparin Induced Thrombocytopenia Type II
clinical_study.official_title: An Open-label, Multi-centre, Clinical Study to Collect Information on the Clinical Use of Argatroban in Patients With Heparin Induced Thrombocytopenia (HIT) Type II Who Require Parenteral Antithrombotic Therapy

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to collect data on the clinical management of Argatroban in patients with suspected or confirmed heparin-induced thrombocytopenia Type II, with or without ongoing thrombosis who require parenteral antithrombotic therapy

primary_outcome.measure: Composite of All-cause Death, Thrombosis (New and Extended) and Unplanned Amputation
primary_outcome.time_frame: During and 30 days after argatroban treatment
During and 30 days after argatroban treatment
During and 30 days after argatroban treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Thrombosis (New and Extended)
primary_outcome.time_frame: During and 30 days after argatroban treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Unplanned Amputation
primary_outcome.time_frame: During and 30 days after argatroban treatment

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Major or Minor Bleeding
primary_outcome.time_frame: During and 30 days after argatroban treatment
primary_outcome.description: Major bleeding is defined as i) overt and associated with a fall in the haemoglobin level 2 g/dl or more, ii) leads to transfusion of 2 units or more, iii) is retroperitoneal, iv) occurs into a major prosthetic joint, or v) in intracranial. Minor bleeding is defined as overt bleeding that does not meet the criteria of major bleeding.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Patients With Platelet Count Recovery

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects aged >= 18 years
- Females of child bearing potential must have a negative urine pregnancy test prior to entry into the study
- Patients with suspected or confirmed heparin-induced thrombocytopenia Type II, with or without ongoing thrombosis who require parenteral anticoagulation
- Signed written informed consent by the subject, or if the subject is unable to do so, consent will be sought from their family member, or a trusted person nominated by the subject or the legal representative
Exclusion Criteria:
- Uncontrolled bleeding
- Severe hepatic impairment (Child-Pugh Class C)
- Hypersensitivity to argatroban or to any of the excipients (sorbitol and ethanol)
- Pregnancy (exclusion by routine urine test)
- Lactating woman

results_reference.citation: Tardy-Poncet B, Nguyen P, Thiranos JC, Morange PE, Biron-Andréani C, Gruel Y, Morel J, Wynckel A, Grunebaum L, Villacorta-Torres J, Grosjean S, de Maistre E. Argatroban in the management of heparin-induced thrombocytopenia: a multicenter clinical trial. Crit Care. 2015 Nov 11;19:396. doi: 10.1186/s13054-015-1109-0.

group.description: start with 1μg/kg/min infusion to be adjusted to aPTT 1.5-3.0 times the baseline values
